column3: str
You've sunk to Fisherman's Bottom, a place for fishermen─you can't go lower than here.
What will you ask?
What do you do here?
What does a fisherman do?
Nothing.
I'm Sisipu, the guildmaster. Well, technically, acting guildmaster.
The actual guildmaster, Wawalago, apparently has better things to do than administer a guild, and so it falls to me.
In hindsight, the thought of a fisherman neglecting his duties shouldn't have come as such a surprise to me.
Our guild members live by a simple code: we catch fish.
From serene seas to roaring rivers, from large lagoons to puny ponds, where there are fish to be fished, the Fishermen's Guild will fish them.
Fishing with nets can yield a fair haul, but requires a ship and trustworthy shiphands. Since you haven't access to a vessel nor any apparent friends, we will not concern ourselves with nets.
“Spare the rod and spoil the adventurer,” as they say. You'll not need an army aboard a dreadnaught to catch a fish─you will need only a rod and your wits.

Quite fitting for a self-sufficient adventurer like yourself, do you not agree? After all, what sort of adventurer wants to browse the nets for hours upon hours when you could be enjoying the great outdoors with a rod and reel?
Well, look what the coeurl dragged in. How goes it, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>?
Now there's a sight for sore eyes. I believed the Admiral when she said you wriggled through the Ul'dahns' nets, but it's still a comfort to find you here in the flesh.

Aye, most people in positions of power know all about your situation. Wawalago doesn't know a thing, though─and I've a mind to keep it that way. He'd never let a fish slip free from his hook, but a secret from his lips? Now that's a different story.
What will you ask?
How fares the guild?
What does a fisherman do?
Nothing.
Sea serpent balderdash notwithstanding, I'd say it's the same as ever.
Which is to say that the fishermen are fishing, the guildmaster is gallivanting, and I'm still saddled with administrative duties.
I swear, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>, one of these days... One of these days...
Well, you're quite a hero around these parts, aren't you? You brought home the Nepto Dragon in your creel, after all!
A role model you are for the younger fishers, aye, and we've a dearth of any <Emphasis>good</Emphasis> role models, to be sure.

But the daily grind will get you, too, if you aren't careful... You'll soon find yourself saddled with all manner of duties before you can say, “Um, Wawalago!” Then it's farewell Dragoncatcher, hello administrative drudge...and another role model is lost to the guild. <sigh>

<If(Equal(PlayerParameter(68),18))>Let me get this straight: you want me to tell you, a master <If(PlayerParameter(4))>fisherwoman<Else/>fisherman</If>, what it is you do. Is that right?<Else/>Not the sharpest knife in the block, are you? First, you forget your rod, and now this.</If>
Our guild members─including <Emphasis>you</Emphasis>, by the way─live by a simple code: we catch fish.
From serene seas to roaring rivers, from large lagoons to puny ponds, where there are fish to be fished, the Fishermen's Guild will fish them.
Fishing with nets can yield a fair haul, but requires a ship and trustworthy shiphands. Since you haven't access to a vessel nor any apparent friends, we will not concern ourselves with nets.
“Spare the rod and spoil the adventurer,” as they say. You'll not need an army aboard a dreadnaught to catch a fish─you will need only a rod and your wits.

<If(Equal(PlayerParameter(68),18))>Thankfully, you've managed to retain the former, though at this rate it won't be long before you're bereft of both.<Else/>A shame that you seem to be bereft of both.</If>
